snippet: With a man who led one of the most successful nonprofit organizations in Laos missing, the Communist government is under increasing pressure to provide answers.
abstract: Disappearance in December of Sombath Somphone, United States-trained agriculture specialist who led one of most successful nonprofit organizations in Laos, has baffled his family and friends and raised alarms that nascent liberalization of Communist country could be sliding backward; Laos government has history of crushing any dissent deemed to be threat to monopoly on power it has held for three and a half decades.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Vientiane and Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: With a man who led one of the most successful nonprofit organizations in Laos missing, the Communist government is under increasing pressure to provide answers.

headline.main: With Laos Disappearance, Signs of a Liberalization in Backslide
headline.print_headline: A Disappearance in Laos Stirs Fears of a Return to Authoritarian Rule
